p: Apoptosis occurs in tissues and varies from necrosis under certain functional disorders [ 46]. Apoptosis is one of the principal characteristics of Cd-related kidney injury. Earlier, it was described that Cd toxicity causes apoptosis in proximal tubules through stimulation of the NF-kB pathway, which contributes to renal dysfunction [ 47, 48]. In this study also, an increased NF-kBp65 protein expression was observed in Cd-treated rats. However, administration of TSA oil in Cd-treated rats substantially restored the NF-kBp65 protein expression. The observed findings are in agreement with the previous findings [ 18, 19]. Therefore, NF-kB inhibition in Cd-intoxicated rats has evidenced the anti-inflammatory ability of TSA oil.
